projects.title: Somelia - Choose the Perfect Wine in Store with AI
projects.description: AI-powered wine recommendation web application that guides users and professionals in their oenological choices.
projects.content:
## Somelia: AI-powered Wine Recommendation Platform

Development of an innovative web application to democratize wine discovery. **Somelia** offers two distinct interfaces: one for the general public and one for retail professionals.

---

## A simple and accessible experience

The application guides users through a **6-question questionnaire** to understand their preferences:

- Simple and intuitive questions (some optional)
- Occasion, dish type, budget, and taste preferences
- Search by city or geolocation from home
- Modern and fluid interface

Artificial intelligence analyzes the answers to suggest **the 3 best wines** perfectly matched to the user's criteria.

---

## Features for users

- Direct access without registration
- Smart 6-question questionnaire
- Personalized AI recommendations
- Geographic search (city or geolocation)
- Responsive interface with smooth animations

---

## Professional platform for retail

Professionals (supermarkets, hypermarkets, chains, big-box stores) have access to a **dedicated management space**:

- Complete wine catalog management
- Real-time stock tracking
- Automatic QR Codes for each point of sale
- Dashboard with detailed statistics
- Public pages accessible via QR Code

Customers can scan the QR Code in-store to access the catalog and receive personalized recommendations.

---

## My role

As **full-stack developer**, I designed and developed the entire application:

- Full development (**Next.js**, **React**, **AdonisJS**, **TypeScript**)
- **Artificial intelligence** integration for recommendations
- Architecture: **PostgreSQL**, **Redis**, **Tailwind CSS**, **Redux Toolkit**
- Geolocation system and city search
- Analytics dashboard for professionals

---

## Technologies used

- **Next.js**: [https://nextjs.org](https://nextjs.org)
- **React**: [https://react.dev](https://react.dev)
- **AdonisJS**: [https://adonisjs.com](https://adonisjs.com)
- **TypeScript**: [https://www.typescriptlang.org](https://www.typescriptlang.org)
- **PostgreSQL**: [https://www.postgresql.org](https://www.postgresql.org)
- **Redis**: [https://redis.io](https://redis.io)
- **Tailwind CSS**: [https://tailwindcss.com](https://tailwindcss.com)
- **OpenAI**: [https://openai.com](https://openai.com)

> This project was completed in 2025.

projects.title: SafeEat - Startup
projects.description: Platform for allergen management in the food service industry.
projects.content:
## SafeEat: Allergen Management Platform

Development of an innovative platform designed for restaurateurs, canteens, and catering services. With **SafeEat**, professionals can:

- Create their restaurant profile
- Add recipes with detailed ingredients
- Organize their complete menus

Customers access this information via a **dynamic QR code**, with mobile-optimized navigation.

---

## A Safe and Personalized Experience for Customers

Users can:

- Filter dishes in real-time based on allergies or diets
- Enjoy a safe, personalized dining experience in compliance with regulations

---

## Features for Restaurateurs

- Export recipes with allergens listed
- Update history
- Clear allergen table for each dish
- Customer comments
- Graphical dashboard for optimizing the offer

---

## My Role

As **co-founder and CTO**, I was responsible for:

- Full development (**React**, **AdonisJS**, **TypeScript**)
- Infrastructure: **Docker**, **PostgreSQL**, **GitHub Actions** (CI/CD), **Hostinger KVM 2** (VPS)

---

## Technologies Used

- **React**: [https://react.dev](https://react.dev)
- **AdonisJS**: [https://adonisjs.com](https://adonisjs.com)
- **TypeScript**: [https://www.typescriptlang.org/](https://www.typescriptlang.org/)
- **Docker**: [https://www.docker.com/](https://www.docker.com/)
- **PostgreSQL**: [https://www.postgresql.org/](https://www.postgresql.org/)
- **GitHub Actions**: [https://github.com/features/actions](https://github.com/features/actions)
- **Hostinger KVM 2**: [https://www.hostinger.com/](https://www.hostinger.com/)

---

## My Role

As **co-founder and CTO**, I supervised all technical development and infrastructure.

> This project was successfully tested, especially at **Bouillon d'Or** in Rouen.

Through these shots, I sought to immortalize the essence of Venice: its colorful facades, elegant gondolas, historic bridges, and mysterious alleyways. Each photo tells a story of this enchanting city.

---

projects.title: MimeTime - Mobile Game
projects.description: A turn-based mime game accessible on mobile, developed solo.
projects.content:
## MimeTime: Turn-based Mime Game

MimeTime is a turn-based mime game that I designed and developed solo. Players can mime words, skip questions, assign points, and track scores via a live scoreboard. The game is available at [https://mime-time.vercel.app/](https://mime-time.vercel.app/) and is best played on mobile. The game includes customizable settings: number of players, points to reach, time per round, etc.

This project allowed me to improve my skills in React, Vite, and Figma, which I used for designing the interface. It is hosted on GitHub and deployed via Vercel.

---

## Technologies Used

- **React**: [https://react.dev](https://react.dev)
- **Vite**: [https://vitejs.dev/](https://vitejs.dev/)
- **Figma**: [https://www.figma.com/](https://www.figma.com/)
- **Vercel**: [https://vercel.com/](https://vercel.com/)
- **GitHub**: [https://github.com/](https://github.com/)

---

## My Role

As **developer and designer**, I designed and developed the entire game, from the interface to the backend implementation.

> This project was completed in March 2025.

projects.title: You Prefer This or That - Halloween Game
projects.description: A small Halloween-themed game built solo, based on a visual elimination concept.
projects.content:
## You Prefer This or That: Halloween Game

You Prefer This or That is a small game I designed and built myself, with a Halloween theme. The concept, inspired by Kombini videos, is simple: choose between two characters. The chosen one continues, and the other is eliminated. This continues until there’s a single winner. During the game, players can view a summary of their past choices, and a full recap is shown at the end along with the winning character. This project helped me improve my skills in React, Vite, and Figma for UI design. It’s hosted on GitHub, deployed with Vercel, and accessible here: [https://you-prefer-this-or-that.vercel.app/](https://you-prefer-this-or-that.vercel.app/)

---

## Technologies Used

- **React**: [https://react.dev](https://react.dev)
- **Vite**: [https://vitejs.dev/](https://vitejs.dev/)
- **Figma**: [https://www.figma.com/](https://www.figma.com/)
- **Vercel**: [https://vercel.com/](https://vercel.com/)
- **GitHub**: [https://github.com/](https://github.com/)

---

## My Role

As **developer and designer**, I designed and developed the entire game, including the interface and backend implementation.

> This project was completed in October 2024.
